summary: This document consists of administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9-10, 2019. It includes a Bureau of Prisons count sheet, an out-count form, and an inmate roster, primarily documenting inmate population counts and housing assignments. The timing is significant as it is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.

events.title: MCC Inmate Count and Roster
events.description: Administrative count of inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, showing a total census of 758 inmates and specific housing unit breakdowns. An inmate roster includes assignments marked 'SUICIDE OR' (likely 'Suicide Observation' or similar status).

events.title: Official Out-Count at MCC
events.description: An official out-count was conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, at 00:35:17 hours, documenting inmate locations by housing unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 9-10, 2019, the immediate period surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
An inmate roster from August 9, 2019, lists several inmates with assignments categorized as 'SUICIDE OR', which likely indicates 'Suicide Observation' status.
A Bureau of Prisons count sheet records a total inmate census of 758 at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at 00:35:17 hours.
The documents are standard prison administrative forms (count sheets, out-count forms, rosters) from the facility where Epstein was held.
No specific inmate names are legible in the provided text excerpts; the records appear focused on numerical counts and procedural documentation.
